channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned blue bin, 19th November
item.description:
It’s been here for a few weeks. In our little road we’ve all got our own bins so it’s not ours. It’s full of rubbish and blocking the pavement. I’m afraid someone will tip it over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buckstone Close, Nunhead, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Access points to Lessness Heath blocked, 19th November
item.description:
There are currently major roadworks in this road where excavated soil is piled high. I spoke wutg workers and they will infill trench when complete but have not been instructed to keep access points clear. These variours access points are obvious and have been there for well over 50 years these should remain accessible after all works have been completed
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pinewood Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of litter for several days around bus stops now amongst leafs, 19th November
item.description:
There is lot of litter around the bus stops at top of Old Kent Road (just past Brick layers arm roundabout) and the bricked area at top of Pages Walk. I watch the street cleaner just walk past it all last Friday and this isn't the first time I have witness this. This is a weekly problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Kent Road, Walworth, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop pole is missing and customer needs to use bus stop, 19th November
item.description:
Bus stop has been out of service for 4 month, the works have been completed outside the bus shelter. Customer is advising TFL are waiting for Camden to put the pole back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haverstock Hill, Belsize Park, Camden Town, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litterbin still not emptied litter still on the verge, 19th November
item.description:
A couple of days ago I reported this problem which had already lasted several days. Yesterday you told me the problem had been "fixed" because appropriate action had been taken (see screenshot attached). This morning I found that what you told me was inaccurate. The litter bin has still not been emptied and there is is still litter on the verge (see photo attached). Please now empty the bin and pick up the litter. Please let me know when this has been done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Stone Park Avenue, Eden Park, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant Road works now both sides of the road, 19th November
item.description:
We have had roadworks in Sevenoaks Way since Feb 2025, this has now moved to Sandy Lane which now cuts off another route that can be taken to avoid Crittall corners roundabout, they have been their for weeks and it is still shut, the roundabout is now gridlocked everyday, there are now roadworks outside Sports Direct going the other way, which means it is now Gridlocked going both ways, my 20 minute journey to work now takes me over an hour and most of that is sitting in the road I live in (Sevenoaks Way) How much longer is this going to go on for, it makes no sense to gridlock both sides of the road which is access to a roundabout that is access to major motorways? I am afraid it is becoming difficult to even leave the house. I look forward to hearing from you. Mrs Claire Still
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Messy and slippy area by 78 bus stop, 19th November
item.description:
At the start/end stop for the 78 bus on St Marys Road it is quite messy. A lot of people walk here and the leaves have been stomped into a mushy mess. There’s also a litter bag that the foxes have ripped apart. Please send someone to make it beautiful.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Mary's Road, Nunhead, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet
